title: SIGINT during setup: spawn+poll loop with interruptible flag
body:
v0.27.0 adds proper SIGINT handling during setup (and all commands). Previously run_command() used blocking cmd.output() which ignored SIGINT. Now uses spawn()+try_wait() poll loop checking is_interrupted() every 10ms, killing child if interrupted.

Key design: 'interruptible' bool threaded through run_command -> run_test -> run_corpus_file. Teardown passes interruptible=false so commands complete despite SIGINT. Setup/tests pass interruptible=true.

Gotcha: ~/.local/bin/cctr vs ~/.cargo/bin/cctr - the install script puts it in .local/bin which takes priority in PATH. Always use ./script/install, not cargo install.
